page.title: 06FARMING LIFE IN KIRKHAM.
page.content:
MR.JOHN HOUGH, NEW HAY FARM
LAND-110 Acres PIGS-4500 with 560 breeders POULTRY-3200 COWS-7(French Charlais) WORKERS-22 When we interviewed Mr. Hough he told us the facts above then went on to explain more.His land was all grass-he did not grow crops,and the farm buildings were all brick with asbestos roofs.His pigs were crossbreeds and in pens.His poultry were hylorids called hisex.The cows were for beef only and was an artificial inseminator which is a place where you get fluid from the bull for the cows so they can reproduce without a bull.
